name: generate_line_chart
description: Generate a line chart to show trends over time. Supports single or multiple series with flexible data field mapping.

items.description: A single data point object with dynamic keys representing field names and values (string, number, or date string)

data.description: Array of data objects. Each object should contain fields that will be mapped to x, y, and optionally z axes. Example: [{ date: '2024-01-01', value: 100, category: 'A' }]

encoding.description: Field mapping configuration. Specifies which data fields to use for x-axis (time/date), y-axis (values), and optional z-axis (grouping)

x.description: X-axis field name (time/date field), should be a date type field from the data

y.description: Y-axis field name(s) (numeric field). Can be a single field name or an array of field names for multiple series

z.description: Z-axis field name (grouping/category field), optional. Used for grouping data into multiple series

height.description: Set the height of the chart, default is 600px.

theme.description: Set the theme for the chart, optional, default is 'default'.

width.description: Set the width of the chart, default is 800px.

smooth.description: Whether to use a smooth curve. Default is false.

showArea.description: Whether to fill the area under the line. Default is false.

showSymbol.description: Whether to show symbols on data points. Default is true.

outputType.description: The output type of the diagram. Can be 'png', 'svg' or 'option'. Default is 'png', 'png' will return the rendered PNG image, 'svg' will return the rendered SVG string, and 'option' will return the valid VISALL configuration.
